BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: ST JOSEPH INSTITUTE FOR THE DEAF

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ST. JOSEPH INSTITUTE FOR THE DEAF (SJI) DELIVERS EXCEPTIONAL LISTENING AND SPOKEN LANGUAGE SOLUTIONS FOR CHILDREN WITH HEARING LOSS, REFLECTING THE CHARISM OF THE SISTERS OF ST JOSEPH OF CARONDELET AND STRIVES TO BE THE PREEMINENT RESOURCE FOR CHILDREN WITH HEARING LOSS AND THEIR FAMILIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ST. JOSEPH INSTITUTE FOR THE DEAF (SJI) DELIVERS EXCEPTIONAL LISTENING AND SPOKEN LANGUAGE SOLUTIONS FOR CHILDREN WITH HEARING LOSS, REFLECTING THE CHARISM OF THE SISTERS OF ST JOSEPH OF CARONDELET AND STRIVES TO BE THE PREEMINENT RESOURCE FOR CHILDREN WITH HEARING LOSS AND THEIR FAMILIES.EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2022, THE ORGANIZATION COMPLETED A RESTRUCTURING PLAN AND FILED FORM 1023 AS A SEPARATE ENTITY. PREVIOUSLY, THE ORGANIZATION WAS PART OF A GROUP EXEMPTION UNDER THE SISTERS OF ST. JOSEPH OF CARONDELET. THE ORGANIZATION WILL FILE ITS INITIAL U.S. FEDERAL AND STATE INFORMATION TAX RETURNS IN FISCAL YEAR 2023.
IRS990.Desc: EARLY INTERVENTION SERVICES: SJI'S EARLY INTERVENTION PROGRAM SERVES CHILDREN BIRTH TO THREE-YEARS-OLD WHO ARE DEAF AND HARD OF HEARING. SJI PROVIDES LISTENING AND SPOKEN LANGUAGE INTERVENTION, AUDIOLOGIC MANAGEMENT, TODDLER CLASSROOM PROGRAMMING, AND FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES. THROUGH A POWERFUL COMBINATION OF AUDIOLOGICAL SERVICES AND LISTENING AND SPOKEN LANGUAGE THERAPY, INFANTS AND THEIR FAMILIES ARE PROVIDED THE TOOLS THEY NEED TO HELP THEIR CHILD ACHIEVE TO THEIR FULLEST POTENTIAL. SJI'S THERAPISTS ARE LISTENING AND SPOKEN LANGUAGE (LSL) PROVIDERS THROUGH STATE-APPROVED PART C PROGRAMS. SERVICES ARE FAMILY-CENTERED, AND ROUTINE BASED. UTILIZING A PARENT COACHING MODEL, WE HELP FAMILIES UNDERSTAND THEIR CHILD'S DIAGNOSIS, RECOMMEND AMPLIFICATION, AND LEARN TECHNIQUES AND SKILLS TO HELP THEIR BABY LEARN TO LISTEN AND TALK. SJI'S GOAL IN EARLY INTERVENTION IS FOR CHILDREN TO MAKE ACCELERATED PROGRESS IN LISTENING AND SPOKEN LANGUAGE SKILLS SO THAT THEY ARE ON PAR WITH THEIR PEERS. FOR FYE 6/30/23, SJI SERVED OVER 300 CHILDREN THROUGH THIS PROGRAM.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SCHOOL-AGE EDUCATIONAL SERVICES: STUDENTS IN SJI'S SITE-BASED ACCELERATED LANGUAGE DEVELOP PROGRAM RECEIVE DAILY INDIVIDUAL SPEECH, LANGUAGE, AND AUDITORY THERAPY FROM OUR SPECIALIZED LISTENING AND SPOKEN LANGUAGE PROVIDERS, WHILE EXPANDING KNOWLEDGE IN THE CLASSROOM WITH LSL FOCUSED TEACHERS. SJI ALSO OFFERS AUDIOLOGY, MUSIC THERAPY, OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY, AND PHYSICAL THERAPY AS PART OF OUR CURRICULUM.SJI ALIGNS CURRICULA WITH STATE STANDARDS AND SUPPORTS TRANSITIONS TO TRADITIONAL ACADEMIC SETTINGS.OFF-SITE SERVICES INCLUDE A FULL CONTINUUM RANGING FROM CONSULTATION TO DIRECT THERAPY PROVIDED IN PERSON OR VIA TELETHERAPY. THE GOAL IS TO "CLOSE THE LANGUAGE GAP AND RETURN STUDENTS TO THEIR LOCAL SCHOOL NO LATER THAN 1ST GRADE WITH LANGUAGE AND ACADEMIC LEVELS THAT MATCH THEIR HEARING PEERS. FOR FYE 6/30/23, SJI SERVED 225 CHILDREN THROUGH THIS PROGRAM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SJI ENGAGED 1816 PUBLIC AFFAIRS GROUP DURING FYE 6/30/23 TO HELP EDUCATE INDIANA LEGISLATORS ABOUT ACCELERATED LANGUAGE DEVELOPMENT SERVICES THAT FAMILIES MAY CHOOSE FOR THEIR CHILD WHO IS DEAF OR HARD OF HEARING. 1816 PUBLIC AFFAIRS GROUP ADVOCATED FOR THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A DEDICATED FUND TO ALLOW FOR EQUAL ACCESS TO LISTENING AND SPOKEN LANGUAGE SERVICES FOR FAMILIES AND CHILDREN IN INDIANA.
ENDOWMENT FUNDS HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO HEARING IMPAIRED STUDENTS THAT OBTAIN SERVICES FROM ST. JOSEPH INSTITUTE FOR THE DEAF.

ST. JOSEPH IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND FROM STATE INCOME TAXES UNDER THE INDIANA NOT-FOR-PROFIT ACT OF 1971, THOUGH IT IS SUBJECT TO TAX ON INCOME UNRELATED TO ITS EXEMPT PURPOSE, UNLESS THAT INCOME IS OTHERWISE EXCLUDED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THERE WAS NO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX FOR 2023 AND 2022. ACCORDINGLY, NO PROVISION OR LIABILITY FOR FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES HAS BEEN RECORDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. DUE TO ST. JOSEPH'S RELATIONSHIP WITH THE CHURCH, IT HISTORICALLY WAS NOT REQUIRED TO FILE U.S. FEDERAL AND STATE OF INDIANA TAX RETURNS UNLESS ST. JOSEPH WAS SUBJECT TO TAX ON UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2022, THE ORGANIZATION COMPLETED A RESTRUCTURING PLAN AND FILED FORM 1023 AS A SEPARATE ENTITY. PREVIOUSLY, THE ORGANIZATION WAS PART OF A GROUP EXEMPTION UNDER THE SISTERS OF ST. JOSEPH OF CARONDELET. THE ORGANIZATION WILL FILE ITS INITIAL U.S. FEDERAL AND STATE INFORMATION TAX RETURNS IN FISCAL YEAR 2023.
SCH G RECLASS OF EVENT EXPENSES 23,834.
SCH G RECLASS OF EVENT EXPENSES 23,834.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COMPLETE COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT, CFO AND FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD. THE BOARD IS PROVIDED AN OVERVIEW AND COPY OF THE FORM 990, WITH SCHEDULE B REDACTED, IN ADVANCE OF ITS FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRE, WHICH IS ALIGNED WITH THE POLICY, IS DISTRIBUTED TO THE BOARD ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. ALL FORMS ARE REVIEWED BY THE PRESIDENT AND, AS NECESSARY, THE BOARD CHAIR, FOR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS. ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS INVOLVING THE BOARD OR THE PRESIDENT ARE DISCUSSED WITH AND MANAGED BY THE BOARD CHAIR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD CONDUCTS AN ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REVIEW OF THE PRESIDENT AND MAKES COMPENSATION RECOMMENDATIONS FOR APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. WHEN AVAILABLE, COMPENSATION STUDIES ARE USED TO PROVIDE INSIGHT INTO THE APPROPRIATE LEVEL OF COMPENSATION. KEY EMPLOYEES REVIEW THEIR ESTABLISHED GOALS AND PERFORMANCE WITH THE PRESIDENT ON AT LEAST AN ANNUAL BASIS. SALARY INCREASES FOR KEY EMPLOYEES ARE DETERMINED BY THE PRESIDENT BASED UPON PERFORMANCE AND APPROVED BUDGET PARAMETERS. WHEN AVAILABLE, COMPENSATION STUDIES ARE USED TO PROVIDE INSIGHT INTO THE APPROPRIATE LEVEL OF COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL DOCUMENTS SUBJECT TO PUBLIC DISCLOSURE ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990 PART XII, LINE 2C, PROCESS FOR OVERSIGHT OF AUDIT:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE WERE NO CHANGES TO THE AUDIT OVERSIGHT OR INDPENDENT ACCOUNTANT SELECTION PROCESSES THIS YEAR.
